countAllKeys

public long countAllKeys(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                         ClientContext context)
Description copied from class: SendableRequest
All key identifiers. Including those not currently eligible to be sent because they are on a cooldown queue, requests for them are in progress, etc.

Specified by:

countSendableKeys

public long countSendableKeys(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                              ClientContext context)
Description copied from class: SendableRequest
All key identifiers currently eligible to be sent. Does not include those currently running, on the cooldown queue etc.

Specified by:
countSendableKeys in class SendableRequest

chooseKey

public SendableRequestItem chooseKey(KeysFetchingLocally fetching,
                                     com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                                     ClientContext context)
Description copied from class: SendableRequest
Choose a key to fetch. Removes the block number from any internal queues (but not the key itself, implementors must have a separate queue of block numbers and mapping of block numbers to keys).

Specified by:
chooseKey in class SendableRequest
Returns:
An object identifying a specific key. null indicates no keys available.

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Description copied from class: SendableRequest
If true, the request has been cancelled, or has completed, either way it need not be registered any more. isEmpty() on the other hand means there are no queued blocks.

Specified by:
isCancelled in interface HasKeyListener
Specified by:
isCancelled in class SendableRequest

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Description copied from interface: RandomGrabArrayItem
If true, will be automatically removed from the RGA, and not returned. True indicates that the item is no longer needed for some reason - in a request, usually that it has either been explicitly cancelled or that it is not needed because other queued blocks have been sufficient. If it becomes useful again, it must be re-registered. LOCKING: Should hold as few locks as possible as this needs to be called while holding the RGA lock(s).

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface RandomGrabArrayItem

getClient

public RequestClient getClient(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Description copied from class: SendableRequest
Get client context object. This isn't called as frequently as you might expect - once on registration, and then when there is an error. So it doesn't need to be stored on the request itself, hence we pass in a container.

Specified by:
getClient in class SendableRequest

listKeys

public Key[] listKeys(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Description copied from class: SendableGet
What keys are we interested in? For purposes of checking the datastore. This is in SendableGet, *not* KeyListener, in order to deal with it in smaller chunks.

Specified by:
listKeys in class SendableGet
Parameters:
container - Database handle.

preRegister

public void preRegister(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                        ClientContext context,
                        boolean toNetwork)
Description copied from class: BaseSendableGet
Called after checking the datastore and before registering the request to be sent. Some gets may want to cancel here, some may want to send an event to FCP.

Specified by:
preRegister in class BaseSendableGet
toNetwork - If true, we are actually going to send requests (unless we cancel in this callback). If false, we completed all the work assigned.
